references.paper_title: Bayesian analysis of some nonparametric problems
references.reason: This paper is foundational to Bayesian nonparametric statistics, introducing concepts and methods crucial to the development of the field and underpinning many of the techniques used in the current paper.
This book provides a comprehensive overview of combinatorial stochastic processes, which are central to the theoretical framework and modeling strategies used in the current work.
This paper introduces the hierarchical Dirichlet process, a fundamental model in Bayesian nonparametrics that is closely related to the methods and models explored in this paper.

references.paper_title: Density modeling and clustering using Dirichlet diffusion trees
references.reason: This paper presents Dirichlet diffusion trees, a specific type of Bayesian nonparametric model that is closely related to the permutree model developed in this paper.

references.paper_title: Representations for partially exchangeable arrays of random variables
references.reason: This paper provides fundamental theoretical results on exchangeability, a key property used to justify many of the modeling approaches and assumptions made in the paper.
